injuries.shortComment: Johnson entered the league's health and safety protocols Thursday, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: Johnson joined the 76ers on a hardship contract early last week, but he'll now be forced to isolate from the team. It's not yet clear whether he's tested positive for the virus or when he'll be able to return.

injuries.shortComment: Trade talks regarding Simmons (personal) have gained momentum in recent days, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: Woj points out that Wednesday is an important date in the process, as 84 percent of players are then able to be traded. Before Wednesday, only 65 percent of players are eligible. Talks can always fall through, but it appears we're nearing an end to the saga that is Simmons' time in Philly. He figures to be a starter and a vital piece of the offense wherever he lands. Fantasy managers who took a gamble in drafting the three-time All-Star may finally be getting a payoff.
